alert.note: Alert for Bell; Coryell; Falls; McLennan; Milam (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 9:57PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of McLennan, eastern Coryell, northwestern Milam, Bell and Falls Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 957 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Troy, or 7 miles northeast of Temple, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Killeen, Waco, Temple, Harker Heights, Belton, Hewitt, Robinson, Bellmead, Woodway, Lacy-Lakeview, Marlin, Rockdale, Cameron, McGregor, Fort Hood, Nolanville, Morgan`s Point Resort, Bartlett, Mart and Salado. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 278 and 341. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central Texas.
